pr_title: Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP

timeline.bodyText: Don't we no longer support Docker-Machine in Windows?
timeline.author: manusa
timeline.diffHunk:

-WARNING: This section is work-in-progress and not yet finished
-
-For {cluster} builds the {plugin} uses the Docker remote API so the URL of your Docker Daemon must be specified. The URL can be specified by the dockerHost or machine configuration, or by the `DOCKER_HOST` environment variable. If not given
+For {cluster} builds the {plugin} uses the Docker remote API so the URL of your Docker Daemon must be specified. The URL can be specified by the dockerHost or by the `DOCKER_HOST` environment variable.

-be specified by the certPath or machine configuration, or by the

replies.bodyText: I checked on the internet about this Docker Machine and it looks like an alternative to Kubernetes. In my opinion, it didn't make sense to keep this parameter
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText:
😆 You've lived a great life without Windows then ;)
Docker machine is a virtual machine that is launched in Windows systems (Home) (I think this is the same for macOS). It's an actual virtual virtual machine running Linux where Docker is hosted. Then the Docker daemon host is shared with windows environment. (Maybe check this (translated) article I wrote way back in 2015 so you understand what this is).
This sort of workaround is/was needed because Windows has no Linux Kernel and obviously Docker can't access to underlying cgroups or namespaces. So as a workaround, Docker runs on a VM and the daemon is shared with Windows. Similar to what happens eval $(minikube docker-env) if you may.
You are probably referring to Docker Swarm when talking about some sort of replacement for Kubernetes, right?
replies.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: I got this from this article: https://stackshare.io/stackups/docker-machine-vs-kubernetes
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText: ohk, let me add it back.
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText:
I can't see any article, it's just a comparison tool. I added Google Drive there too for completeness ;P
https://stackshare.io/stackups/docker-machine-vs-kubernetes-vs-google-drive
replies.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: oh, looks like I shouldn't trust random stuff on internet
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText: oh, looks like I shouldn't trust random stuff on internet

replies.bodyText: Why do you need docker health checks when we have the same thing in kubernetes?
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText:
I'm not saying that this feature is necessary or not (I haven't analyzed that so I don't have an opinion).
I'm just saying that this configuration is used in parts of the code.
replies.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: looks like you're right. We read this option and convert it to readiness/liveness probes
replies.author: rohanKanojia

timeline.message:
Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP

+ Removed parameters: loadNameParameters, portPropertyFile since they are not referenced in code
+ Remove `<run>` and `<external>` from Image Configuration docs
+ Add missing HealthCheck section
+ Added missing ImageName configuration section. We don't need to add Container Names
  and Name Patterns since image builds don't really work with patterns and we don't
  manipulate individual containers while doing a hot reload during watch(we're updating
  image which triggers a rolling update).

timeline.bodyText: please do keep this as real XML comments, some syntax highlighting machines will break when processing this and also this code is not copy-pasteable since that is not a valid XML syntax.
timeline.author: manusa

timeline.bodyText: Why is this no longer a heading? did the document structure change? Maybe we want it to be an H4?
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: move the label (and maybe the link reference) to the top of the table where it makes sense (As a Figure title), following the _configuration.adoc pattern
replies.author: manusa
